installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# steamcmd Base Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
# Image to install with is 'ghcr.io/parkervcp/installers:debian'


## just in case someone removed the defaults.
if [[ "${STEAM_USER}" == "" ]] || [[ "${STEAM_PASS}" == "" ]]; then
    echo -e "steam user is not set.\n"
    echo -e "Using anonymous user.\n"
    STEAM_USER=anonymous
    STEAM_PASS=""
    STEAM_AUTH=""
else
    echo -e "user set to ${STEAM_USER}"
fi

## download and install steamcmd
cd /tmp
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamcmd
curl -sSL -o steamcmd.tar.gz https://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/client/installer/steamcmd_linux.tar.gz
tar -xzvf steamcmd.tar.gz -C /mnt/server/steamcmd
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamapps # Fix steamcmd disk write error when this folder is missing
cd /mnt/server/steamcmd

# SteamCMD fails otherwise for some reason, even running as root.
# This is changed at the end of the install process anyways.
chown -R root:root /mnt
export HOME=/mnt/server

## install game using steamcmd
./steamcmd.sh +force_install_dir /mnt/server +login ${STEAM_USER} ${STEAM_PASS} ${STEAM_AUTH} $( [[ "${WINDOWS_INSTALL}" == "1" ]] && printf %s '+@sSteamCmdForcePlatformType windows' ) +app_update ${SRCDS_APPID} $( [[ -z ${SRCDS_BETAID} ]] || printf %s "-beta ${SRCDS_BETAID}" ) $( [[ -z ${SRCDS_BETAPASS} ]] || printf %s "-betapassword ${SRCDS_BETAPASS}" ) ${INSTALL_FLAGS} validate +quit ## other flags may be needed depending on install. looking at you cs 1.6

## set up 32 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk32
cp -v linux32/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk32/steamclient.so

## set up 64 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk64
cp -v linux64/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk64/steamclient.so

## add below your custom commands if needed


## Arma Reforger setup
# Check for successful installation
if [[ ! -f $HOME/ArmaReforgerServer ]]; then
    echo -e "\n\nSteamCMD failed to install the Arma Reforger Dedicated Server!"
    echo -e "\tTry reinstalling the server again.\n"
    exit 1
fi

mkdir -p $HOME/profile

echo -e 'Creating default "config.json" configuration file...'
cat > $HOME/config.json << EOF
{
	"bindAddress": "0.0.0.0",
	"bindPort": ${SERVER_PORT},
	"publicAddress": "${SERVER_IP}",
	"publicPort": ${SERVER_PORT},
	"game": {
		"name": "${SERVER_NAME}",
		"password": "${SERVER_PASS}",
		"passwordAdmin": "${ADMIN_PASS}",
		"scenarioId": "${SCENARIO_ID}",
		"maxPlayers": ${MAX_PLAYERS},
		"visible": true,
		"gameProperties": {
			"serverMaxViewDistance": 500,
			"serverMinGrassDistance": 50,
			"networkViewDistance": 500,
			"disableThirdPerson": ${DISABLE_THIRD},
			"fastValidation": true,
			"battlEye": ${BATTLEYE},
			"VONDisableUI": false,
			"VONDisableDirectSpeechUI": false
		},
		"mods": []
	}
}
EOF

echo -e "\nArma Reforger Dedicated Server successfully installed!\n"

variables.name: Automatic Updates
variables.description: Quickly checks for any server or mod updates on startup, and updates if necessary.

variables.name: Server Region
variables.description: Region listed in the server browser. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes can be used in this field.

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: Name displayed in the server browser.

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: Maximum number of players allowed to join the server.

variables.name: Server Password
variables.description: Password required for clients to enter before they can join the server. Leave empty to have no password.

variables.name: Scenario ID
variables.description: ID of scenario to run/play. Valid IDs can be viewed in the console upon startup of the server.

variables.name: Auto Joinable
variables.description: Set if the session can be selected through the auto join feature.

variables.name: Visible in Server Browser
variables.description: Set the visibility of the server in the Server Browser.

variables.name: Enable BattlEye
variables.description: Enables the anti-cheat engine on the server and requires all clients to be running it.

variables.name: [Advanced] Max FPS
variables.description: Sets a maximum FPS limit for the server, saving performance in some cases. Leave empty for no limit.

variables.name: [Advanced] Log FPS Interval
variables.description: How often (in seconds) to log the FPS and other debug stats to the console. Set to 0 to disable.

variables.name: [Repair] Validate Server Files
variables.description: "true" to enable; empty to disable. Validates all server files when Automatic Updates is enabled. Note: This will significantly increase server startup times, so it is recommended to only enable this when needed.

variables.name: [Advanced] Arma Reforger Dedicated Server App ID
variables.description: Used for installation and updates. Rarely needs to be changed.
